```{python}
#| label: fig-current-mirror-reg-casc
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "A regulated-cascode current mirror. The simple common-source amplifier is used to keep the drain voltage of the bottom transistor constant, thus improving the current mirroring accuracy and output resistance."
import schemdraw as sd
import schemdraw.elements as elm
sd.svgconfig.svg2 = False
with sd.Drawing(canvas='svg') as d:
    d.config(unit=2)
    d.config(fontsize=16)

    ibias1 = elm.SourceI().down().label(r'$I_\mathrm{bias1}$').dot()
    M3 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).drop('source').theta(0).label('$W_2/L_2$')
    elm.Line().down(d.unit/2)
    M1 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).drop('source').theta(0).label('$W_1/L_1$')
    elm.Ground()

    elm.Line().right().at(M1.gate).length(d.unit/4).dot()
    d.push()
    elm.Line().up().toy(ibias1.end)
    elm.Line().left().to(ibias1.end)
    d.pop()

    elm.Line().right().at(M1.gate).length(d.unit*2)
    M2 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).anchor('gate').drop('drain').theta(0).reverse().label(r'$k \cdot W_1/L_1$', ofst=-2.8)
    l1 = elm.Line().up(d.unit/4)
    d.push()
    elm.Line().up(d.unit/4)
    M4 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).anchor('source').theta(0).reverse().label(r'$k \cdot W_2/L_2$', ofst=-2.8)
    elm.Ground().at(M2.source)
    elm.Line().at(M4.drain).up(d.unit/2).dot(open=True).label(r'$I_\mathrm{out} = k \cdot I_\mathrm{bias1}$', 'right')
    d.pop()

    elm.Line().left(d.unit*3/4).idot().color('blue')
    M5 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).anchor('gate').theta(0).label(r'$M_\mathrm{aux}$').color('blue')
    elm.Line().at(M5.source).down().toy(M1.source).color('blue')
    elm.Ground().color('blue')
    l2 = elm.Line().at(M5.drain).up().toy(M3.gate).dot().color('blue')
    elm.Line().up().toy(ibias1.end).color('blue')
    ibias2 = elm.SourceI().up().label(r'$I_\mathrm{bias2}$').reverse().color('blue')

    elm.Line().at(l2.end).to(M3.gate)
    elm.Line().at(l2.end).to(M4.gate)

    # vdd line
    elm.Line().at((ibias1.start[0]-d.unit/4, ibias1.start[1])).to((ibias2.end[0]+d.unit/4, ibias2.end[1])).label(r'$V_\mathrm{DD}$').linewidth(3)
```
